<|channel|>analysis<|message|>We need to extract statutory or constitutional basis. We have 6 docs. Need to search for constitutional amendments or statutes. Likely in Complaint. Best to search regex across all docs for pattern like "Fourteenth Amendment", "First Amendment", "Eighth Amendment", "42 U.S.C.", "ADA", "Rehab Act", "Title II", "§" etc. Use regex search_document_regex across all docs. Then read the matched contexts to confirm. So choose search_document_regex with pattern that captures amendment or statute names. For example: `(?i)(Fourteenth Amendment|First Amendment|Eighth Amendment|42 U\.S\.C\. § 1983|ADA|Rehabilitation Act|§ )` but the pattern might be too broad. But we can just search for "Amendment" and "Act" and "42 U.S.C." etc. Let's focus on constitutional amendments: pattern `(?i)(Fourteenth Amendment|First Amendment|Eighth Amendment|Sixth Amendment|Tenth Amendment|Seventh Amendment|Ninth Amendment|Thirteenth Amendment)`.

Also statutes: `(?i)(42 U\.S\.C\. § \d{1,3})`. Also "ADA Title" maybe "Americans with Disabilities Act". But we just need distinct values. So best to search for "Amendment" and "U.S.C.".

I'll use regex pattern `(?i)(Fourteenth Amendment|First Amendment|Eighth Amendment|42 U\.S\.C\. § \d{1,3}|\bAct\b|\bTitle\b)` but that might return many. Let's focus on "Amendment" and "42 U.S.C.".

I'll run search_document_regex on all documents.<|end|><|start|>assistant<|channel|>commentary to=functions.search_document_regex <|constrain|>json<|message|>{"doc_name":"all","pattern":"(?i)(Fourteenth Amendment|First Amendment|Eighth Amendment|42 U\\.S\\.C\\. § \\d{1,3})","flags":["IGNORECASE"],"top_k":5,"context_tokens":200}

The snippet also refers to Section 703(k) of Title VII, 42 U.S.C. § 2000e-2(k). That is a statutory provision but is part of Title VII. The snippet also references "42 U.S.C. § 2000e-6(b)" but that's part of Title VII but might be procedural. It's also a part of Title VII. }
